specification_date: Find the specification date by label "Specification"/"Date". Keep the exact format from the document (no normalization). Add the date to specification_date.
contract_no: Extract the contract number by labels "Contract No", "Contract No.", or "Contract". Write only the number (no date or counterparty). Add it to contract_no.
additional_agreements: If the document mentions addenda ("Addendum", "Supplementary Agreement", "DS No..."), extract their numbers (and dates if present) in one line; if multiple, join with "; ". Add to additional_agreements.
buyer: Identify the buyer by labels "Buyer", "Customer", "Consignee". Keep the full legal name (and address if shown) in one line. Add to buyer.
seller: Identify the seller by labels "Seller", "Supplier". Keep the full legal name (and address if shown) in one line. Add to seller.
incoterms: Extract Incoterms: a three-letter code (EXW/FOB/CFR/CIF/DAP, etc.) and, if shown, the place (port/city). Keep the wording exactly as in the document. Add to incoterms.
terms_of_payment: Find payment terms ("Terms of payment", "Payment"). Keep the full wording (e.g., "ADV. 20%, BALANCE C/COPY DOC."). Add to terms_of_payment.
total_price: Take the overall total for the specification ("Total ...", possibly with Incoterms and currency). Prefer the explicit total; if missing, sum line amounts. Keep currency and number format as in the document. Add to total_price.
HS_code: If the specification has a list of HS codes, collect all unique codes (format "0304.81...") and join with "; ". If codes are only in line items, collect them from the table. Add to HS_code.
country_of_origin: If "Country of origin"/"Origin" is explicitly shown, extract the origin country (e.g., "CHILE") and add to country_of_origin. If missing, leave empty (do not infer).
products: The "products" block is expandable: create product_1, product_2, ... for each line item in the table and keep order. For each position fill all available fields. If an attribute is given once in a shared block (e.g., one Latin species for all positions), duplicate it in the relevant product_i. In token_refs include references to the source fragments/cells used.
products[*].name_product: Take the commercial name from the "Description of goods"/"Product" column. If multi-line, join into one line. Add to products[i].name_product.
products[*].latin_name: If a Latin species name is shown (often in parentheses, e.g., "SALMO SALAR"), extract it and add to products[i].latin_name. If not shown, leave empty.
products[*].size_product: Extract size/grade/pack (e.g., "3-4 LB (1.3-1.8 KG)", "80/120"). Keep the wording as in the document. Add to products[i].size_product.
products[*].unit_box: If a unit is explicitly shown ("per carton", "per kg", "unit", "CASE", etc.), extract and add to products[i].unit_box. If not shown, leave empty.
products[*].packages: Extract number of packages by labels "Packages", "Cases", "Cartons", "No. of packages". If type is shown, keep both (e.g., "1375 CASES"). Add to products[i].packages.
products[*].net_weight: Extract net weight per item ("Net weight", "NET KG", etc.). Keep number and unit as in the document (dot/comma). Add to products[i].net_weight.
products[*].gross_weight: Extract gross weight per item ("Gross weight", "G.W."). Keep number and unit as in the document. Add to products[i].gross_weight.
products[*].price_per_unit: Find unit price by labels "Unit price", "Price per ...". Keep currency and number format exactly as in the document. Add to products[i].price_per_unit.
products[*].total_price: Extract the line total ("Line total", "Amount"). If no explicit value, compute as quantity/weight x price_per_unit, keeping currency and format. Add to products[i].total_price.
